advisory.name: RLSA-2022:2110
advisory.synopsis: Low: grub2 security, bug fix, and enhancement update
advisory.topic:
An update for grub2 is now available for Rocky Linux 8.
Rocky Enterprise Software Foundation Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Low. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
advisory.description:
The grub2 packages provide version 2 of the Grand Unified Boot Loader (GRUB), a highly configurable and customizable boot loader with modular architecture. The packages support a variety of kernel formats, file systems, computer architectures, and hardware devices.
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
Additional Changes:
For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Rocky Linux 8.6 Release Notes linked from the References section.

fixes.description: [RFE] GRUB does not consider information from proxy dhcp server
grub2-mkconfig is never run on kernel upgrade even if GRUB_ENABLE_BLSCFG=false
grub-boot-success.service should not be started inside systemd-nspawn container
RPM grub2-tools-minimal is shipping prelink config files although prelink is absent in rhel8
GRUB_TERMINAL_INPUT=at_keyboard makes grub stay on boot menu instead of starting the timeout
CVE-2021-3981 grub2: Incorrect permission in grub.cfg allow unprivileged user to read the file content
Cannot EFI chainload onto local disk when EFI partition is in Software Raid
grub on OpenFirmware : search --hint-ieee1275= does not work
grub2 signed by Red Hat Test Certificate
